column12: Title
column13: Abstract

column12: ELEVATOR SYSTEM COMPRISING DEFLECTING ELEMENTS HAVING DIFFERENT GROOVE GEOMETRIES
column13: An elevator system includes a car and/or a counterweight connected to a belt having a plurality of ribs. The elevator system further has at least two deflecting elements over which the belt is guided and which each have a plurality of grooves. The grooves of at least one of the deflecting elements are configured with geometries that differ from the grooves of another of the deflecting elements. The belt has longitudinal ribs that cooperate with the grooves.

column12: Elevator system comprising deflecting elements having different groove geometries
column13: The invention relates to an elevator system (100), comprising a cabin (102) and/or a counterweight (104). The elevator system (100) further comprises a belt (10) having a plurality of ribs (22). The elevator system further comprises two deflecting elements (30, 40, 108, 110, 112, 114), over which the belt (10) is guided and which each comprise a plurality of grooves (34, 44). The grooves (34, 44) are designed here in such a manner that they have geometries which differ from one another. The invention further relates to a belt (10, 50, 60, 70) for an elevator system (100).

column12: Sistema elevador con elementos de desviación con diferentes geometrías de ranura
column13: La invención se refiere a un sistema de ascensor (100), que comprende una cabina (102) y/o un contrapeso (104). El sistema de ascensor (100) comprende además una correa (10) que tiene una pluralidad de nervaduras (22). El sistema de ascensor comprende además dos elementos deflectores (30, 40, 108, 110, 112, 114) sobre los que se guía la correa (10) y que comprenden cada uno una pluralidad de ranuras (34, 44). Las ranuras (34, 44) están diseñadas aquí de tal manera que tienen geometrías que difieren entre sí. La invención se refiere además a una correa (10, 50, 60, 70) para un sistema de ascensor (100). column12: ELEVATOR SYSTEM COMPRISING DEFLECTING ELEMENTS HAVING DIFFERENT GROOVE GEOMETRIES
BELT FOR SUPPORTING A CAR AND/OR A COUNTERWEIGHT OF A LIFT SYSTEM AND ROLLER FOR GUIDING SUCH A BELT
column13: The invention relates to a belt (10, 50, 70, 92, 94, 106) for supporting a car (102) and/or a counterweight (104) of a lift system (100), which belt has a plurality of tensile members (12) extending in the longitudinal direction and a shell (16) in which the tensile members (12) are embedded. Furthermore, the belt (10, 50, 70, 92, 94) has a plurality of ribs (20) extending in the longitudinal direction, wherein the cross sections of the ribs (20) are formed in such a way that, at least in one portion of at least one flank (22) of the ribs (20), the flank (22) or a tangent (82) applied to the flank (22) extends relative to a plane (14) of the tensile members (12) at an angle of between 50° and 80°. The invention also relates to a roller (30, 60, 90) for guiding such a belt (10, 50, 70, 92, 94, 106).

column12: SUSPENSION MEMBER ARRANGEMENT FOR AN ELEVATOR AND MONITORING ARRANGEMENT FOR MONITORING A SUSPENSION MEMBER
column13: A suspension member arrangement (2) for an elevator (1)is proposed. The suspension member arrangement (2) comprises a suspension member (11) including a plurality of electrically conductive load-bearing cords (23) commonly embedded in an electrically isolating matrix material (25)and a first connector (31) and a second connector (33) attached to the suspension member (11) and electrically contacting cords (23) within the suspension member (11) in a contacted end region (29) thereof. Therein,the first connector (31) electrically contacts and electrically interconnects in parallel a first group (35) of cords (23) comprising a first plurality of directly neighboring cords (23)and the second connector (33) electrically contacts and electrically interconnects in parallel a second group (37) of cords (23) comprising a second plurality of directly neighboring cords (23). The approach may facilitate electrically contacting cords (23) of a suspension member using a simple type of connector (31, 33). Furthermore, deteriorations in characteristics of the suspension member (11) may be electrically detected with high accuracy.

column12: SUSPENSION MEMBER ARRANGEMENT FOR ELEVATOR AND MONITORING ARRANGEMENT FOR MONITORING SUSPENSION MEMBER
column13: A suspension member arrangement (2) for an elevator (1) is proposed. The suspension member arrangement (2) comprises a suspension member (11) including a plurality of electrically conductive load-bearing cords (23) commonly embedded in an electrically isolating matrix material (25) and a first connector (31) and a second connector (33) attached to the suspension member (11) and electrically contacting cords (23) within the suspension member (11) in a contacted end region (29) thereof. Therein, the first connector (31) electrically contacts and electrically interconnects in parallel a first group (35) of cords (23) comprising a first plurality of directly neighboring cords (23)and the second connector (33) electrically contacts and electrically interconnects in parallel a second group (37)of cords (23) comprising a second plurality of directly neighboring cords (23). The approach may facilitate electrically contacting cords (23) of a suspension member using a simple type of connector (31, 33). Furthermore, deteriorations in characteristics of the suspension member (11) may be electrically detected with high accuracy.

column12: Support for an elevator
column13: Die Erfindung betrifft ein Tragemittel (1) bestehend aus mindestens zwei Seilen (3a, 3b, 3c, 3d, 3e, 5a, 5b, 5c) zur Kraftaufnahme in Längsrichtung und einem Seilmantel (2), wobei die Seile in einer gemeinsamen Ebene im Seilmantel angeordnet sind, sodass der Seilmantel die Seile umschließt. Dabei weist zumindest ein Bereich des Tragemittels ein gegenüber anderen Bereichen des Tragemittels reduzierte Schneidbarkeit auf. Durch eine gezielte Reduzierung der Schneidbarkeit zumindest eines Bereichs des Tragemittels kann eine mutwillige oder vorsätzliche Beschädigung des Tragemittels mit einem Schneidwerkzeug minimiert oder sogar verhindert werden.

column12: SUSPENSION MEMBER ARRANGEMENT FOR AN ELEVATOR AND MONITORING ARRANGEMENT FOR MONITORING A SUSPENSION MEMBER
Suspension member arrangement for elevator and monitoring device for monitoring suspension member
column13: A suspension member arrangement for an elevator is presented. The suspension member arrangement comprises a suspension member comprising a plurality of electrically conductive load-bearing cables commonly embedded in an electrically insulating base material, a first connector and a second connector, the first connector and the second connector being attached to the suspension member and electrically contacting the cables within the suspension member in a contact end region of the suspension member. Wherein the first connector electrically contacts and electrically interconnects a first set of cables including a plurality of directly adjacent first cables in parallel, and the second connector electrically contacts and electrically interconnects a second set of cables including a plurality of directly adjacent second cables in parallel. The method may facilitate electrical contact of the cable of the suspension member using a simple type of connector. In addition, deterioration of the characteristics of the suspension member can be electrically detected with high precision.

column12: arranjo de membro de suspensão para um elevador e arranjo de monitoramento para monitorar um membro de suspensão
column13: a presente invenção refere-se a um arranjo de membro de suspensão (2) para um elevador (1). o arranjo de membro de suspensão (2) compreende um membro de suspensão (11) que inclui uma pluralidade de cabos de carga eletricamente condutores (23) comumente embutidos em um material de matriz eletricamente isolante (25) e um primeiro conector (31) e um segundo conector (33) ligados ao membro de suspensão (11) e aos cabos de contato elétrico (23) dentro do membro de suspensão (11) em uma sua região extrema contatada (29). aí, o primeiro conector (31) contata eletricamente e interconecta eletricamente em paralelo um primeiro grupo (35) de cabos (23) que compreende uma primeira pluralidade de cabos diretamente vizinhos (23) e o segundo conector (33) contata eletricamente e interconecta eletricamente em paralelo um segundo grupo (37) de cabos (23) que compreende uma segunda pluralidade de cabos diretamente vizinhos (23). a abordagem pode facilitar que cabos de contato elétrico (23) de um membro de suspensão usem um tipo simples de conector (31, 33). além disso, deteriorações em características do membro de suspensão (11) podem ser detectadas eletricamente com alta precisão.

column12: Suspension member arrangement for an elevator and monitoring arrangement for monitoring a suspension member
column13: A suspension member arrangement for an elevator includes a suspension member having a plurality of electrically conductive load-bearing cords commonly embedded in an electrically isolating matrix material, a first connector and a second connector each attached to the suspension member and electrically contacting the cords within the suspension member in a contacted end region thereof. The first connector electrically contacts and electrically interconnects in parallel a first group of the cords being a first plurality of directly neighboring ones of the cords. The second connector electrically contacts and electrically interconnects in parallel a second group of the cords being a second plurality of directly neighboring ones of the cords. The suspension member arrangement facilitates electrically contacting the cords of the suspension member using a simple type of connector whereby deteriorations in characteristics of the suspension member can be electrically detected with high accuracy.

column12: KOPPLUNGSVORRICHTUNG ZUM ANSCHLIESSEN VON GERÄTEN AN EIN BUSSYSTEM
column13: The device has at least one bus side connection unit (23) for connecting the coupler to the bus system (1) and at least one equipment side connection unit (26) for connecting to equipment. The equipment side connection unit has a number of contact elements (27-30), each with one of a number of predefined functional characteristics (A-D). At least some contact elements are variably supplied with one of the predefined functional characteristics.

column12: Anordnung zum Aufschweißen eines Folienpakets auf eine Stromableiterschiene einer Batteriezelle
column13: Die Erfindung betrifft eine Anordnung (1) zum Aufschweißen eines Folienpakets (2, 2') auf eine Stromableiterschiene (3) einer Batteriezelle,wobei eine Stromableiterschiene (3) einen Lagerbereich (6) und einen Kontaktierungsbereich (5) zum Auflegen und Verschweißen eines Folienpakets (2, 2') aufweist,wobei ein Spannstempel (4) einen Aufsetzbereich (10) zum Aufsetzen auf den Lagerbereich (6) oder zum Positionieren gegenüber dem Lagerbereich (6) undeine Ausnehmung (11) aufweist, durch die hindurch ein im Kontaktierungsbereich (5) auf der Stromableiterschiene (3) aufliegendes Folienpaket (2, 2') bei aufgesetztem Spannstempel (4) für einen Laserstrahl (20) zugänglich ist,wobei der Kontaktierungsbereich (5) einen Zentralabschnitt (7) und wenigstens zwei Flankenabschnitte (8a, 8b) aufweist,wobei der Spannstempel (4) weiterhin wenigstens zwei Abstreicheinrichtungen (14a, 14b; 14a', 14b') für die wenigstens zwei Flankenabschnitte (8a, 8b) aufweist,wobei die Abstreicheinrichtungen (14a, 14b; 14a', 14b') jeweils quer zur Aufsetzrichtung (AR) beweglich am Spannstempel (4) gelagert sind,wobei die Abstreicheinrichtungen (14a, 14b; 14a', 14b') jeweils mit wenigstens einem Federelement (16a-16d; 41, 42) verbunden sind, welches auf einen Zentralbereich (17) des Spannstempels (4) zu eine Rückstellkraft auf die jeweilige Abstreicheinrichtung (14a, 14b; 14a', 14b') ausüben kann. Mit der Anordnung ist zuverlässig eine gute Qualität einer Schweißverbindung zwischen dem Folienpaket und der Stromableiterschiene erreichbar, und insbesondere können Beschädigungen an den Folien und Lufteinschlüsse zwischen den Folien minimiert werden.

column12: LINKING UNIT TO CONNECT DEVICE TO BUS SYSTEM
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To design a linking unit which enables linking a security sensor and a standard sensor freely by a standard and cost-effective plug connection.

SOLUTION: The linking unit connects devices such as a sensor, an actuator, a noncontact protective device (electrically sensitive protective equiment-ESPE), a light barrier or a controller to a bus system. The linking unit comprises at least one connecting unit on a bus side to connect it to the bus system and at least one connecting unit on a device side to connect the device to the linking unit. The connecting unit on a device side comprises n-contact point elements (n>1), each of which has one of a group of m-predefined functional properties (m>1). At least a certain number of the contact point elements are designed as variable contact point elements to which one of the predefined functional properties is allotted variably.

column12: Coupling device for connecting devices to a bus system
column13: Es wird eine Kopplungsvorrichtung zum Anschließen von Geräten wie beispielsweise Sensoren, Aktoren, berührungslos wirkenden Schutzeinrichtungen (BWS), Lichtschranken oder Steuerungen an ein Bussystem beschrieben. Die Kopplungsvorrichtung umfasst zumindest eine busseitige Anschlusseinheit zum Anschließen der Kopplungsvorrichtung an das Bussystem und zumindest eine geräteseitige Anschlusseinheit zum Anschließen eines Gerätes an die Kopplungsvorrichtung. Die geräteseitige Anschlusseinheit umfasst n (n > 1) Kontaktelemente, von denen jedes eine aus einer Menge von m (m > 1) vordefinierten Funktionseigenschaften besitzt. Zumindest ein Teil der Kontaktelemente ist als variable Kontaktelemente ausgebildet, die jeweils variabel mit je einer der vordefinierten Funktionseigenschaften belegbar sind.

column12: Coupling apparatus for the connection of devices to a bus system
column13: A coupling apparatus is described for the connection of devices such as sensors, actuators, contact free protection devices (electro-sensitive protection equipment ESPE), light barriers or controls to a bus system. The coupling apparatus includes at least one connection unit at the bus side for the connection of the coupling apparatus to the bus system and at least one connection unit at the device side for the connection of a device to the coupling apparatus. The connection unit at the device side includes n (n>1) contact elements of which each has one pre-defined functional property from a set of m (m>1) pre-defined functional properties. At least some of the contact elements are designed as variable contact elements to each of which one of the pre-defined functional properties can be variably assigned.

column12: Steuerungssystem
column13: The system has a control module (10) reading sensors to generate a control signal. A data memory module (16) is mechanically connected to a cable (14), which is connected to the control module and a connection unit (22). A data memory unit (18) e.g. flash memory, of the data memory module is utilized for storing configuration data of the control module in a memory card. Communication paths transfer configuration data between the data memory unit of the data memory module and the control module. An independent claim is also included for a method for storing configuration data of a control module using a control system.

column12: BELT FOR CARRYING AN ELEVATOR CAR AND/OR A COUNTERWEIGHT OF AN ELEVATOR SYSTEM
column13: A belt (7) for carrying an elevator car (5) and/or a counterweight (13) of an elevator system (1) comprises: a belt body (17) with a traction side (21) for contacting a drive sheave (11) of the elevator system (1) and a reverse side (19) opposite the traction side (21), wherein the belt body (17) has, on the traction side (21), a groove profile (24) adapted to an outer contour of the drive sheave (11) and, on the reverse side (19), a profile that differs from the groove profile (24); a plurality of tension members (22, 22a, 22b) embedded in the belt body (17) for transferring tensile forces, wherein each tension member (22, 22a, 22b) is formed by a plurality of twisted-together strands (31, 31a, 31b) and each strand (31, 31a, 31b) is formed by a plurality of twisted-together aramid fibres (23).

column12: Control system
column13: The system has a control module (10) reading sensors to generate a control signal. A data memory module (16) is mechanically connected to a cable (14), which is connected to the control module and a connection unit (22). A data memory unit (18) e.g. flash memory, of the data memory module is utilized for storing configuration data of the control module in a memory card. Communication paths transfer configuration data between the data memory unit of the data memory module and the control module. An independent claim is also included for a method for storing configuration data of a control module using a control system.

column12: Control system
column13: Die Erfindung betrifft ein Steuerungssystem, insbesondere ein Sicherheitssteuerungssystem, mit wenigstens einem Sensor, wenigstens einem Steuerungsmodul (10) zur Auslesung des wenigstens einen Sensors und zur Erzeugung eines Steuersignals, wobei das wenigstens eine Steuerungsmodul (10) wenigstens einen Anschluss für ein Kabel aufweist, das mit dem Steuerungsmodul verbindbar ist. Das erfindungsgemäße Steuerungssystem weist weiterhin ein Datenspeichermodul (16) auf, das mechanisch mit dem mit dem Anschluss zu verbindenden Kabel verbunden ist und eine Datenspeichereinheit (18) zur Speicherung von Konfigurationsdaten der Steuerung umfasst. Ein Kommunikationspfad ist zur Übermittlung von Konfigurationsdaten zwischen dem wenigstens einen Steuerungsmodul (10) und dem wenigstens einen Datenspeichermodul (16) vorgesehen, wobei das Kabel nicht oder nicht nur zur Datenübermittlung zwischen der Datenspeichereinheit (18) des wenigstens einen Datenspeichermoduls (16) und dem wenigstens einen Steuerungsmodul (10) vorgesehen ist. Außerdem betrifft die Erfindung ein Verfahren zur Speicherung von Konfigurationsdaten eines Steuerungsmoduls, insbesondere eines Sicherheitssteuerungssystems.

column12: Control System
column13: The invention relates to a control system, in particular to a safety control system, comprising at least one sensor, at least one control module for the reading out of the at least one sensor and for the generation of a control signal, wherein the at least one control module has at least one connection for a cable which can be connected to the control module. The control system in accordance with the invention furthermore has a data memory module which is mechanically connected to the cable to be connected to the connection and a data memory unit for the storage of configuration data of the control. A communications path is provided for the transfer of configuration data between the at east one control module and the at least one data memory module, wherein the cable is not provided, or is not only provided, for the data transfer between the data memory unit of the at least one data memory module and the at least one control module. The invention additionally relates to a method for the storage of configuration data of a control module, in particular of a safety control system.
